Investigator Hate Incidents

  Salary:
  Â£27,511 per annum

  Location:
  Leicester

  Company:
  DE MONTFORT UNIVERSITY

  Apply for this job
  Join De Montfort University (DMU) in Leicester as a Investigator Hate Incidents.
  DMUis an ambitious, globally-minded institution with a relentless focus on delivering quality teaching and learning, and a campus-wide focus on providing a sector-leading student experience. A culturally rich university with a palpable commitment to the public good, it strives to maintain a stimulating and inclusive environment where staff and students are able to thrive. The university is a vibrant, multicultural hub of learning, creativity and innovation that never surrenders to convention. Our success is built on a fantastic student experience coupled with award-winning teaching and world-class facilities that help students develop the skills and attitudes employers demand.
  The departmentThe Estates & Facilities Directorate is large and diverse, employing circa 300 people, ranging from plumbers, electricians, carpenters, cleaners, porters,leisure centre assistants, to property management professionals, architects, project officers, CAD, space management, sustainability and energy and administrative personnel.
  The roleWithin this role, you will co-ordinate investigations and support the No Space for Hate team in relation to instances of acts of violence or hostility directed at students of the university because of who they are or who someone thinks they are. This role includes interviewing witnesses and alleged offenders and the collation of information and intelligence, liaising with the No Space for Hate team and other support services, recommending courses of action under the General Rules and Practices Affecting Students. The categorisation of incidents and trends is also part of this role, reporting to the Head of Security. The role is fundamental to providing management information about student safety and trends.
  The ideal candidateTo be successful, you will have conducted high quality forensic investigations including interviews and analysis of information and an understanding of vulnerable and hostile witnesses with the ability to deal positively with sensitive and/or confrontational situations. You will also have the ability to demonstrate a passion for equality and diversity issues, with a good standard of literacy in order to demonstrate the creation of good quality, structured case files to Court or Tribunal standard.
  What's next?
  Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you!! To submit an application, visit the DMU careers site to submit a full application. To ensure you are successful, please detail how you meet the criteria specified within the job description and person specification.
  ** Please note CV submitted via a job board will not be considered as an application**
  Closing date: 18 October 2020
